intro: Microlicia cuspidifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved microlicia, is a tropical flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Microlicia cuspidifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
